frame.name: Being_questionable
frame.definition: <def-root>In this frame, an <fen>Entity</fen> or <fen>Behavior</fen> is suspicious or otherwise subject to question. The general implication is that the <fen>Entity</fen> or <fen>Behavior</fen> provides evidence for some (as yet unproven) socially undesirable conclusion about a (usually implicit) <fen>Social_actor</fen>. (Such conclusions often include the idea that some individual is lying, or that a crime was committed.) <ex>We found some <t>suspicious</t> <fex name="Entity">checks</fex> lying on his desk.</ex> <ex>It <m>was</m> rather <t>suspicious</t> <fex name="soc">of you</fex> <fex name="Behavior">to leave the party just before the police arrived</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Behavior
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the state of affairs or action of the social actor that is regarded as susipcious. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Behavior</fen> is suspicious. <ex>That looks like <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>suspicious</t> activity.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Social_actor
FE.definition: <def-root>An individual that is suspected of wrongdoing because of the <fen>Behavior</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.</def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> metonymically stands in for a <fen>Behavior</fen> that saliently involves the <fen>Entity</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: suspicious.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: arousing a feeling that something may be dangerous or may indicate criminal or unlawful behavior

lexUnit.name: questionable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of suspect morality, honesty, value, etc.

lexUnit.name: fishy.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: arousing feelings of doubt or suspicion.

lexUnit.name: dubious.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not to be relied upon.
